column4: Pay up or dry up - Egyptian gas at a crossroads
column5: LONDON An offshore gas find in the Nile Delta is strong new evidence that Egypt has the resources to end power cuts and get export income flowing again. Its challenge is to persuade wary international oil companies to develop them.

column4: Lumber Liquidators stock falls after report of search by feds
column5: Sept 27 Shares of Lumber Liquidators Holdings  plunged 10 percent in premarket trading on Friday after the Associated Press reported that federal authorities searched the retailer's headquarters and a business location.

column4: Japan regulator chides Mizuho for loans to crime network members
column5: TOKYO Japan's banking regulator on Friday chided Mizuho Financial Group  for failing to take sufficient action against loans it had extended through a consumer credit agency to members of organized crime networks.

column4: Japan regulator chides Mizuho for loans to crime network members
column5: TOKYO  Sept 27 Japan's banking regulator on Friday chided Mizuho Financial Group for failing to take sufficient action against loans it had extended through a consumer credit agency to members of organised crime networks.

column4: NRC to meet on concrete flaw at New Hampshire Seabrook reactor
column5: Sept 27 Efforts by NextEra Energy Inc to address degradation of concrete at the Seabrook nuclear power plant in New Hampshire will be the subject of a public meeting conducted by staff of the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission staff on Oct. 9.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St falls as U.S. government faces possible shutdown
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 27 U.S. stocks declined on Friday and the S&P 500 and Dow posted their first weekly drop in four  as Democrat and Republican lawmakers struggled to agree on an emergency funding bill to avert a U.S. government shutdown days away.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall Street falls as federal budget deadline draws near
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 27 U.S. stocks declined on Friday  putting the S&P 500 and Dow on track for their first weekly drop in four  as congressional Democrats and Republicans struggled to pass a federal budget to avert a government shutdown days away.

column5: NEW YORK  Sept 27 U.S. stock index futures fell on Friday as deadlines loomed for a political agreement in Washington that would keep the U.S. government running and avoid a debt default  with no clear solution in sight.

column4: ANZ  Singapore's United Overseas eye Hong Kong's Wing Hang Bank - WSJ
column5: Sept 27 Singapore's United Overseas Bank Ltd  and Australia & New Zealand Banking Group Ltd  have shown interest in buying Hong Kong's Wing Hang Bank Ltd   the Wall Street Journal said  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Pentagon sees decisions on U.S. weather satellite in next months
column5: WASHINGTON The Pentagon is expected to reach decisions in coming months on how to meet its weather forecasting needs after the 2012 termination of a nearly $15 billion program being built by Northrop Grumman Corp  a senior official told Reuters on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Shuanghui to cut stake in Spain's Campofrio
column5: MADRID  Sept 27 The Chinese group that inherited the largest single stake in Spanish food company Campofrio  plans to sell enough shares to avoid making a forced takeover  though some analysts viewed the move merely as a postponement.

column4: Countrywide shareholders cash in on Britain's housing recovery
column5: LONDON Two investors in Britain's biggest estate agency group Countrywide  have sold a combined 94 million pound ($150 million) stake in the company  a source close to the deal said  cashing in on the country's buoyant housing sector.

column4: For America's Cup  return to San Francisco no sure thing
column5: SAN FRANCISCO After a spectacular America's Cup regatta capped by home-team Oracle's thrilling comeback victory  there should be little question about the event returning to San Francisco.

column4: SAILING-For America's Cup  return to San Francisco no sure thing
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Sept 27 After a spectacular America's Cup regatta capped by home-team Oracle's thrilling comeback victory  there should be little question about the event returning to San Francisco.

column4: Petrobras CEO sees no near-term fuel price increase in Brazil
column5: BRASILIA  Sept 27 The president of state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileira SA said on Friday she sees no chance of a fuel price increase in Brazil in the short term.

column4: UPDATE 3-U.S. FDA warns Pfizer's drug Tygacil raises risk of death
column5: Sept 27 Pfizer Inc's antibacterial drug Tygacil increases the risk of death whether used as authorized by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration or for unapproved conditions  the agency warned on Friday.

column4: Raytheon wins $243 million U.S. Navy order for SM-6 missiles
column5: WASHINGTON Raytheon Co  has won a contract worth $243 million to build 89 new Standard Missile-6 interceptors for the U.S. Navy  the Pentagon said on Friday.

column4: Fitch Updates Recovery Analyses for U.S. Media & Entertainment Sector
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  September 27 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has published updated recovery  analyses for the following U.S. media and entertainment companies: --AMC Entertainment Inc. --Regal Entertainment Group --Univision Communications  Inc. --Clear Channel Communications  Inc. --Clear Channel Worldwide Holdings Inc. --Houghton Mifflin Harcourt Publishers  Inc. The interactive recovery analysis worksheets are available at  'www.fitchratings.com' un

column4: Shares of cloud company RingCentral jump 28 pct in debut
column5: Sept 27 Shares of RingCentral Inc  a cloud-based business communications services provider  rose as much as 28 percent in their market debut on Friday.

column4: Corsair group wins fight for RBS's 314 UK branches
column5: LONDON  Sept 27 A consortium led by private equity firm Corsair will pay 600 million pounds to be an anchor investor in 314 branches being sold by Royal Bank of Scotland .

column4: 'Foodimals' stalk animated film world of 'Cloudy With a Chance of Meatballs 2'
column5: LOS ANGELES Fruits  vegetables and cheeseburgers get their film shelf-life extended in the animated comedy "Cloudy With a Chance of Meatballs 2 " as the franchise explores a new world of living  breathing "foodimals."

column4: Telecom Italia chief Bernabe considering resigning: source
column5: MILAN Telecom Italia Executive Chairman Franco Bernabe is considering resigning at a board meeting scheduled for Thursday  a source close to the situation said  as his plans to relaunch the heavily indebted company may not get enough backing.

column4: Telecom Italia chief Bernabe considering resigning: source
column5: ROME Telecom Italia  Chairman Franco Bernabe is considering resigning at a board meeting scheduled for Thursday  a source close to the situation said.
